intro: Corydalis flabellata, commonly known as the fanleaf corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are lanceolate and often hairy. Corydalis flabellata thrives in woodland and meadow environments, preferring partial shade and well-drained soil. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
